title: Hello, honeydew world
body:
First post! This is a tiny JSON-powered blog living inside a microsite.
You can edit this file directly to add new entries.

The goal: keep things light, playful, and easy to change without touching HTML.

title: Treat this as an idea garden
body:
Instead of long, polished essays, think of each post as a small plant.
You can come back, prune, rewrite, or delete whenever you like.

JSON makes it easy to rearrange, tag, or archive posts later.

title: Building the Honeydew Microsite
body:
This site started as a bare repo and turned into a honeydew-themed playground.

What we added so far:
- A Bootstrap-powered layout with sections for projects, links, and a JSON-backed blog.
- A Three.js hero scene where low-poly solids fall and roll "downhill" behind the content, with cursor pushback, lighting, grain, and adjustable motion blur.
- A floating control panel that lets you tweak how many shapes are on screen and how fast they move, plus a manual light/dark theme toggle.
- A live status bar at the bottom of the hero that pulls fresh headlines from r/collapse, truncates them, and links out to the original threads.

The plan is to keep treating this as a tiny lab: ship weird ideas, wire up odd data sources, and let the UI drift toward whatever feels interesting next.
